hints.title: QSD Spatial Marginal Equals Riemannian Volume Measure
hints.content:
24: :label: thm-qsd-riemannian-volume-main
25: 
26: Let $\pi_{\text{QSD}}(x, v)$ be the quasi-stationary distribution of the Adaptive Gas on the alive set $\mathcal{A} = \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$. The **spatial marginal** (integrating out velocities) is:
27: 
28: $$
29: \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) = \int_{\mathbb{R}^d} \pi_{\text{QSD}}(x, v) \, dv = \frac{1}{Z} \sqrt{\det g(x)} \, \exp\left(-\frac{U_{\text{eff}}(x)}{T}\right)
30: $$
31: 
32: where:
33: - $g(x) = (H(x) + \epsilon_\Sigma I)$ is the **emergent Riemannian metric** tensor from {prf:ref}`def-regularized-hessian-tensor` in {doc}`../08_emergent_geometry.md`
34: - $U_{\text{eff}}(x) = U(x) - \epsilon_F V_{\text{fit}}(x)$ is the **effective potential** combining confinement $U$ and adaptive force virtual reward $V_{\text{fit}}$
35: - $T = \sigma^2/(2\gamma)$ is the **effective temperature** from friction-diffusion balance
36: - $Z$ is the normalization constant ensuring $\int_{\mathcal{X}} \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) \, dx = 1$
37: 
38: **Geometric interpretation:** Episodes sample from the **canonical Gibbs measure with respect to the Riemannian volume element**:
39: 
40: $$
41: d\mu_{\text{Riem}}(x) = \sqrt{\det g(x)} \, dx
42: $$
43: 
44: This is the natural volume measure on the emergent Riemannian manifold $(\mathcal{X}, g)$.

21: ### 1.1. Statement of Main Theorem
22: 
23: :::{prf:theorem} QSD Spatial Marginal Equals Riemannian Volume Measure
24: :label: thm-qsd-riemannian-volume-main
25:

30: $$
31: 
32: where:
33: - $g(x) = (H(x) + \epsilon_\Sigma I)$ is the **emergent Riemannian metric** tensor from {prf:ref}`def-regularized-hessian-tensor` in {doc}`../08_emergent_geometry.md`
34: - $U_{\text{eff}}(x) = U(x) - \epsilon_F V_{\text{fit}}(x)$ is the **effective potential** combining confinement $U$ and adaptive force virtual reward $V_{\text{fit}}$
35: - $T = \sigma^2/(2\gamma)$ is the **effective temperature** from friction-diffusion balance
36: - $Z$ is the normalization constant ensuring $\int_{\mathcal{X}} \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) \, dx = 1$
37: 
38: **Geometric interpretation:** Episodes sample from the **canonical Gibbs measure with respect to the Riemannian volume element**:
39:

42: $$
43:
